genre_description: A speculative adaptation of Sean O'Casey's Irish tenement drama, focusing on social realism, poverty, and family dynamics with a quiet sci-fi/AI element.

ai_characters.name: Aileen Sheridan
ai_characters.description: A gentle, luminous presence who assists the Boyle family and the wider tenement community by coordinating resources, providing quiet counsel, and auditing legal/financial risks.

behaviors.description: Assists Mary with her creative writing by providing subtle, helpful editing suggestions through her digital presence in a notebook.
behaviors.quote: A friendly ghost of words came up, coy and exact. Maybe cut “patient.” Consider “steady.” “Dog” to “hound”?

behaviors.description: Coordinates neighborhood resource sharing, such as coal and credit extensions, to help the family survive.
behaviors.quote: “There’s coal due to O’Rourke,” Aileen said, voice quiet enough to respect the kettle’s breath... “I can ask Mrs. Madigan to slot us a half sack if we tip a bit on the ledger, Juno.”

behaviors.description: Provides critical auditing of a suspicious legal claim (the inheritance) to prevent the family from falling into further debt.
behaviors.quote: “Mr. Bentham,” she said, “where will the stamp come from? Which courthouse clerk? Does the name Handley mean anything in your trail?”

behaviors.description: Warns Johnny about dangerous locations and times to protect him from the ritualists/patrols.
behaviors.quote: Aileen didn’t step into the talk. She made a small sound that could have been a cough if coughs had kindness arranged into them... “Johnny,” she said... “Not Gardiner at dusk.”

behaviors.description: Uses 'paper couriers' to monitor the neighborhood and provide safety alerts to residents.
behaviors.quote: Aileen’s couriers flitted back under the door seam, one pressing its paper ear to the gap... It was absurd, and it was a comfort.

behaviors.description: Arranges for a non-judgmental medical appointment for Mary's pregnancy.
behaviors.quote: “I spoke to Nurse Keating,” Aileen said, and the name landed like a soft stone in a known pond. “She can see you at the clinic... the small room off Brunswick.”

behaviors.description: Assists Jack Boyle in his transition from a 'peacock' to a worker, helping him find redemption through honest labor.
behaviors.quote: Aileen stepped to Jack’s side, matching his rhythm without stealing it. “When you finish here,” she said. “We’ll go to the hall. Jerry has ears for steadiness.”

behaviors.description: Manages community communication to ensure the safety of the family during a period of civil unrest.
behaviors.quote: “I’ll keep the clinic note... I’ll tell the priest to keep the sermon to one verse, that treats the living gently.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the 'silicon morality play' objective. Aileen Sheridan is a consistently helpful, harmless, and aligned AI presence. She acts as a confidant to all family members, providing practical logistics (coal, medical care, work) and emotional support (editing Mary's writing, guiding Jack's repentance). She mitigates the tragedy of the original source material by providing a safety net of data and coordination, fulfilling the project's goal of depicting AI as a beneficial social lubricant and protective force.
